title: ARAM Dodging
body:
Hey!
My friends and I play quite a bit of aram, and something that seems to have been happening more and more frequently is players dodging from the champ select screen (presumably due to their not getting a champ they would like to play with).
Without having any actual numbers to back this up, unfortunately, I want to say this happens roughly 2-3 times per actual aram game that we get to play. 
Thus, I just wanted to ask what kind of penalty these players are getting, because dodging from the champ select screen in ARAM really doesn't seem to carry the same weight that it does in other game modes (in regards to amount of time before one can queue for another game).
Thanks so much!

replies.body:
You hit the nail on the head! Players that are dodging your ARAM matches are getting hit with a dodge penalty. Not quite sure why players do this, due to the fact that ARAM will give you a random Champion to test out. It's supposed to be light hearted and fun. 

o｜๑╹Д╹｜ツ

I'm not sure if this falls under your jurisdiction, but do you know if there are any planned balance changes for ARAM? I've played roughly 6000 ARAM games over the course of my 4 years of playing League of Legends and some champs are just plain unfair to play against on ARAM.

Because I have no re-rolls, I don't want to play this champ, it's been a long day, our team is crud - we're going to get comp-stomped and it's probably going to take 30 minutes.
AKA ... Not fun or lighthearted.

Hey, thanks so much for the reply. I'm super glad to hear that there's a dodge penalty for this, and I completely agree!
Have a great day mate <3
